Scions of death by poisoning, piscodaemons are cruel even by daemonic standards, delighting in slow and painful suffering. To a piscodaemon, death is but the icing on a putrescent cake—its true pleasure comes from watching, hearing, smelling, and even tasting raw anguish. While poisons and venoms are piscodaemons' preferred tools, their cruel claws are more than capable of tearing enemies asunder if necessary. Piscodaemons dwell in fetid swamps and noxious waterways, including the River Styx, the Bile Sluice, and the Drowning Court of Charon, Horseman of Death. They are often accompanied by cadres of hydrodaemons—representations of death by drowning. **Enhance Venom** ([divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [misfortune](/Traits.aspx?ID=110), [necromancy](/Traits.aspx?ID=117), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126)) **Trigger** A creature within 30 feet attempts a saving throw against piscovenom; **Effect** The creature takes an additional 2d8 poison damage even if it succeeds at its save. --- **Speed** 25 feet, swim 40 feet **Melee** claw +23 ([Evil](/Traits.aspx?ID=64), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103)), **Damage** 2d10+12 slashing plus 1d6 evil and [Grab](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=18) **Melee** tentacle +23 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Evil](/Traits.aspx?ID=64), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103)), **Damage** 2d6+12 bludgeoning plus 1d6 evil and piscovenom **Divine Innate Spells** DC 29 - **1st** [Detect Alignment](/Spells.aspx?ID=65) (at will; good only), [Detect Poison](/Spells.aspx?ID=67) (at will) - **4th** [Dimension Door](/Spells.aspx?ID=69) (at will), [Stinking Cloud](/Spells.aspx?ID=309) (×3) - **5th** [Dimension Door](/Spells.aspx?ID=69) - **Constant (2nd)** [See Invisibility](/Spells.aspx?ID=271) **[Constrict](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=10)** 2d10+6 bludgeoning, DC 30 **Gory Rend** The piscodaemon makes two claw Strikes against the same creature.
